Opportunity

Abt Associates seeks a qualified Principal Associate with expertise in analytical statistics, evaluation, and evaluation technical assistance to join our Research, Monitoring, & Evaluation Capability and play a leadership role on project work for the U.S. Department of Education (ED). As a member of the Research, Monitoring, and Evaluation Capability team, you will conduct research, monitoring, and evaluation services at the highest levels of quality and rigor to generate evidence-based insights.

The Principal Associate will serve as Principal Investigator on evaluation studies for ED and provide strategic expertise on ED-funded evaluation technical assistance contracts. The ideal candidate will have subject matter expertise in K-16 education, be highly knowledgeable about the What Works Clearinghouse Standards, and have demonstrated experience overcoming barriers to field-based evaluations through creative evaluation design and execution.

Key Roles And Responsibilities

 Provide technical leadership on education evaluation technical assistance strategies and tasks, leading and mentoring teams of experienced evaluation technical assistance providers. 
 May also lead education evaluation projects by providing demonstrated expertise in the design or execution of impact analyses and other technical tasks, including leading and mentoring associated teams . 
 Contribute subject matter expertise in K-16 education particularly focused on high need students and with strategies to improve state education agency, district, educator, and/or student outcomes. 
 Review, analyze, and synthesize information using appropriate practices and techniques and ensure that projects are conducted with sound practices and techniques. 
 Provide individual evaluation technical assistance to evaluators designing and conducting impact and implementation studies of educational strategies to improve student achievement. This includes applying What Works Clearinghouse standards to evaluation designs to ensure valid impact evaluations and providing guidance on developing intervention logic models and measures of fidelity of implementation. 
 Work collaboratively as part of a team by communicating respectfully, meeting deadlines, and exercising initiative to resolve complex challenges. 
 Communicate clearly and collegially with evaluators of differing technical abilities and to establish strong and effective relationships with the recipients of evaluation technical assistance. 
 Develop guidance and deliver presentations on evaluation issues to audiences including federal grant program staff, IES, and evaluators. 
 Represent Abt in a professional manner and effectively communicate with clients, external partners, and the public. 
 Develop and disseminate project deliverables and other products to share project findings through papers, technical reports, client briefings, presentations, blog posts, podcasts, videos and/or social media. 
 Lead business development activities including proposal writing and development. 
 Cultivate and maintain excellent business development relationships with clients and external partners. 

What We Value

 Demonstrated technical expertise related to providing evaluation technical assistance to support federally-funded state and local program evaluations. 
 Exceptional quantitative skills with demonstrated technical expertise related to experimental and quasi-experimental designs for program evaluation in education. 
 Expertise in advanced statistical analysis and its applications in education research. 
 In-depth knowledge of What Works Clearinghouse standards. 
 A record of publications, presentations, and other knowledge-dissemination activities. 
 Aptitude and interest in mentoring less-experienced staff and managing multidisciplinary teams. 
 A collegial demeanor and interest in mentoring the next generation of evaluators and evaluation technical assistance providers. 
 Strong commitment to Abt’s mission and to equity, diversity, and inclusion. This includes a commitment to incorporating principles of diversity, equity, and inclusion into research and interactions with colleagues; prioritizing understanding multiple alternative perspectives; and embracing diverse perspectives, abilities, racial/ethnic and cultural backgrounds, ages, gender identities and expressions, educational experiences, and life stories. 
 Demonstrated experience translating research and making it accessible to practice, policy, and/or government audiences. 
 Demonstrated success with business development and proposal or grant writing. 
 A well-rounded interpersonal skill set with a demonstrated ability to build relationships with clients, funders, and education leaders, and to work effectively in a team environment. 
 Masters degree + 15 years of relevant experience, or PhD + 10 years of relevant experience 

What We Offer

We foster an environment where you can Thrive Your Way. Our innovative total rewards programs are designed to help balance your work and personal life. The approach toward your wellbeing centers around comprehensive benefits, flexible schedules, and professional development.
